author: penguin3332
title: Small Soccer
review:
I got this set for my town because I did not have any sport fields in my town.  I am really happy with this set

Great things-
-Four really cool mini figures including nice, detailed heads
-Nice flexible "goal nets"
-Interesting stickers portraying mini figures playing soccer
-Fun playabilty
-Cool way to have goal keepers shoot and block
-Nice "city field" look
-Large for a twenty dollar set

Dislikes-
-Stickers on the mini figures torsos
-Hard to play two on two (but easy to use)

Overall this is a great soccer set for those who want a soccer set either for fun, or just to complete a collection.  I was not disappointed with the looks either.

author: Flex
title: There are better soccer sets
review:
I saw this set on sale for $14.99 so I thought I might as well pick it up. I actually liked the the set less then I thought I would.  

Pros: There are some good pieces, like a lot of black fences and plates.

Cons: There is only two plyers on each team- older soccer feilds had at least three. Also, the new goals are horrible- the old nets wree way better.

-Overall: I wouldn't buy this unless you really like soccer sets.

author: I_like_Lego
title: Cheap and good
review:
My dad bought this set for me for 3.00 CAN but the box had large holes in it that's why it was cheap,when i got home to build it i walked to go get something and when i came back my cat was playing with the one of the socerball's,this set came with no stickers.

PROS
.Minifigs all minifigs are great especially the one with black hair,great for making clone captains
.Nets nice flexibale nets great for making a Lego hammock
.Minifigs accessories are great including the red and blue caps
.Socerballs are nice and i like the blue adidas ball
.Green 1x2 are great for fake 100$ bills
.The platform that the minifigs stand on have allot of green parts
.The goalie sticks are nice and sturdy
.The fence is nice
CONS
.If you look at the box you know you really can't play soccer with it but it's good for spare parts
.I never even knew the set had stickers till i saw a Brickset review

author: Dash_Justice
title: There are better soccer sets.
review:
I happend to find this on sale for $12, and was dissapointed to see that it is not nearly as good past soccer sets. 

The Good:

  • A decent supply of parts, black fence pieces, net pieces, and more.
  • You could play soccer if you really want too, it includes a rare blue Addidas ball.

The Bad:

  • Only 2 players on each team, old sets had at least 3.
  • The goalies tend to fall sideways during play due to the rubber band placement.
  • The minifigures use stickers.

The Verdict:

If you want a small soccer set, I recomend 3421, otherwise, skip this one, as it's not terribly usefull for anyhting else.
